main event: A strange light was observed in the western sky for 8 minutes near Niles, Illinois on August 14, 1963.
interesting points: The light was shaped like a drop of water tilted at a 30-degree angle and changed shape slightly as it moved.
The light was as bright as the brightest star and had a reddish edge.
The light changed direction several times and varied in altitude during the observation.
No aircraft characteristics, such as visible surfaces or propulsion, were observed.
The light went behind a cloud, emerged below it, and then gained speed and disappeared from view.
sighted object: a bright, white light with a reddish edge, shaped like a tilted drop of water
photographs: no, the report does not include any photographs
